text: Thanks to @GeorgiaPower and the dedication of our utility service providers from in- and out-of-state throughout #HurricaneMichael. You’ve been working around-the-clock to get Georgia up and running again, and we appreciate it! https://t.co/0NdIuPHzFd

I was glad to be able to sit down with community leaders while I was in Albany, Ga., yesterday. They’ve faced several tough natural disasters in the last few years and have been relentless in their work to rebuild. We’re thankful to be able to work with such committed leaders. https://t.co/APgCXoYkmA

This great announcement from @AUG_University is perfect timing for #CyberSecurityAwarenessMonth during October. This is wonderful news for the CSRA, our state and the future of #cybersecurity. https://t.co/SnkVU5VwmX

Congratulations to Clayton Fuller of Lookout Mountain, Ga., and Latham Sadler of Atlanta, Ga. These fine Georgians have been appointed as 2018-2019 White House Fellows. Learn more: https://t.co/KXrLn8XekX https://t.co/sBbBZ70oCw

Appreciated being with @VP Pence during his visit to Georgia yesterday. The administration has been very attentive to Georgians during this difficult time following #HurricaneMichael, and we’re so grateful. 
https://t.co/0LYOCbfb9z

Our staff has been on the ground, and I visited many areas of Georgia hit by #HurricaneMichael. We’ll be working to recover for a long time to come, but the swift, thorough response from state, federal & local leaders, nonprofits, utilities & communities is very much appreciated. https://t.co/6us1kUHw3x

Our economy is humming, and our @GaPorts saw double-digit increases in cargo handled in Savannah and Brunswick last month. I’m glad to be working with our state leaders and Georgia delegation to make progress on federal port funding. https://t.co/SF9SSVI0rw

Georgia students in grades 5 - 12 who work hard serving their communities may be interested in applying for the “Spirit of Community Awards” through @PruSpirit and @NASSP! Apply by Nov. 6, 2018, to be considered for the 2019 awards: https://t.co/Pu3OzOfd8F
Thanks to our @ga_dps, the @GeorgiaGuard and all who are working tirelessly to help Georgians recover from #HurricaneMichael. https://t.co/wTqAadhSij

We’re very proud of the work @GeorgiaStateU has been doing to reach and graduate more students. The university’s success makes a difference for the @CityofAtlanta, our state and its students! https://t.co/1UuwYvXIwV

Since its founding, @USArmy’s @FortBenning has played an instrumental role in training warfighters & projecting power. We’re very proud of the Maneuver Center of Excellence & the brave service members who have trained here or called Fort Benning home. Happy birthday! #Benning100 https://t.co/gYdISPjJsa
Please note the opportunity available this afternoon in Tifton, Ga., if you had timber damaged by #HurricaneMichael. https://t.co/kLKSX1gjqt

Congratulations again to Judge Stan Baker, our new U.S. District Court Judge for the Southern District of Georgia. He took the formal oath of office on Friday. https://t.co/XI9sJc4hRW via @SavannahNow
Congratulations to @FortBenning’s Ranger team on another win at the International Sniper Competition! https://t.co/T3WMDq2BUK

Congratulations and thanks to Master Sgt. Bryan Smith, a native of Augusta, Ga., on being named the '2017 @NavalServiceTrg Marine of the Year.' More about his service: https://t.co/PL5hhFT63x via @AUG_Chronicle

Our staff was glad to meet @JohnsCreekHS student Aditya Bora in D.C. recently for the International Chief Science Officer Summit. We enjoy seeing Georgia students actively engage in science, technology, engineering and math #STEM education! https://t.co/zV3oKrUVlL via @jcherald

Thank you to @SavTech, @GwinnettTech, @wiregrasstech, @augustatech1 and @CGTC on your dedication to excellence in educating our veterans. Congratulations on earning recognition for your services in @MilitaryTimes! https://t.co/Yna4Kg9WZa

It’s great to see @AUG_University, @CCGAtweets, @GeorgiaSouthern, @GeorgiaStateU, @kennesawstate, @UNG_News, @universityofga and five of Georgia’s @TCSG colleges recognized as ‘best schools for military students in 2019.’ https://t.co/zuvOMmz6jG

.@USDOL, @HHSGov and @USTreasury are responding to Americans’ needs for quality, affordable health coverage. I’m glad to see the new proposed regulation to give small businesses a tax break for helping to pay for their employees’ health coverage. https://t.co/2AcQdoVCAr

Polio cases have been reduced by 99.9 percent worldwide, from 350,000 per year in 1988 to just 22 cases in 2017. I appreciate the work of @Rotary and the @ShotAtLife program in our work to #EndPolio. #VaccinesWork https://t.co/eaOmqfMQ82

It was a privilege to present Jennifer Gerding and her family with a flag flown above the U.S. Capitol in memory of her father, William Carroll, a @USNationalGuard veteran of WWII and the Korean War, who was awarded two Silver Stars, a Bronze Star, and two Purple Hearts. https://t.co/QdAk1k5Kh8

I condemn in the strongest possible terms any and all violence or even threats of violence against elected officials, media and members of the public. I thank law enforcement and first responders who are working around the clock to keep Americans safe each day.

Honored to receive the ‘Harry S Truman Award’ from @NGAUS1878. As @VAChair, I'm proud of our work to pass the ‘Harry W. Colmery Veterans Educational Assistance Act’ to help our service members receive education benefits that meet their needs. https://t.co/INw5bdpGye https://t.co/PiQlN2yiuo

Today, @POTUS signed our comprehensive #opioidcrisis response legislation into law. We worked across party lines, committees and both chambers of Congress to pass this important legislation, and @SenLamarAlexander & @SenOrrinHatch deserve great credit.

We’re making important progress in the #opioidcrisis from a legislative standpoint. But everyone can join these efforts by discarding unused medications. This Saturday, Oct. 27, is National Prescription Drug #TakeBackDay. https://t.co/DmBDYU5xUr

Thanks to @POTUS for signing ‘America’s Water Infrastructure Act of 2018’ into law to increase the funding authorization to keep the Savannah Harbor Expansion Project on track, aid coastal areas & update funding authorization for water infrastructure. More https://t.co/MGeytH4GhG
I was honored to receive this award, and it is a privilege to serve our veterans! https://t.co/QXHdJ0M3M6

The #opioidcrisis was rightly named a national health emergency by @POTUS, and the ‘SUPPORT for Patients and Communities Act’ he signed into law yesterday authorizes and funds a broad range of tools to help us fight this epidemic and save lives. More: https://t.co/y7ClNQByl9

Saturday, Oct. 27, is National Prescription Drug #TakeBackDay. Find Georgia locations where you can safely discard unused medications online here at the #DoseofReality website: https://t.co/OWLbmKrWVQ
Georgians in #HurricaneMichael affected areas, please take note of this additional health concern. https://t.co/2ntP1owF7m
Today is #NationalDayoftheDeployed. Please join me in honoring and praying for our deployed service members. https://t.co/pgHEDZgYoD

Georgia’s working forests are an economic engine. As a member of the Congressional Working Forests Caucus, I’m proud to support the hardworking Georgians who grow the trees, manage the forests, and manufacture the products we all rely on every day. #NationalForestProductsWeek https://t.co/3b0Yxo7oMC

Low unemployment and today’s GDP news are evidence that the reforms - including the ‘Tax Cuts and Jobs Act’ - and regulatory rollbacks we’ve worked on for the last two years have delivered for hardworking Americans. https://t.co/aUNi0lR9B0

I am sickened and saddened by today's horrible tragedy at the Tree of Life Synagogue in Pittsburgh. I condemn any such act and stand in solidarity with our Jewish neighbors. Dianne and I are praying for the victims, their families and the community.
Well done, @usairforce @116ACW! This “outstanding unit” does incredible work out of @RobinsAFB_GA. Thank you for your service and dedication! https://t.co/cjS7ZSeXqx

Proud to have again earned a 100 percent score & Award for Manufacturing Legislative Excellence from @ShopFloorNAM, but it’s a true honor to support our manufacturers & Georgia’s world-class workforce through smart policies & quality technical education. https://t.co/RwTUut0ThT

The October edition of @NationalGuard magazine has a column I wrote, dedicated to our citizen soldiers and their full-time commitment. Check it out on page 14: https://t.co/H0USjZ357a{%22issue_id%22:533546,%22page%22:14}

Being awarded the @USNationalGuard’s Harry S. Truman award means so much to me, but it is a privilege to work to ensure that our nation’s veterans receive quality care. We owe them nothing less than everything. https://t.co/SV9tpknEX3
Another exciting economic development announcement for Georgia. Congrats to the Hall County community and @gdecd! Thank you for your leadership, @GovernorDeal. https://t.co/bKUfHty27g
The distinguished White House Fellowship program is a unique, nonpartisan opportunity, and applications for the 2019-2020 program are now available. Learn more here: https://t.co/zmjVFDwkoQ

Chief Justice Harris Hines was a Cobb County legend whose faithful service and expertise on the bench made a positive impact on our entire state. He always did what was right. I’m greatly saddened by the sudden passing of my friend. (1/2)

Congratulations & thanks to @GovernorDeal, @gdecd, & our communities that work together to support job creation & greater prosperity for all Georgians. This designation for the 6th year is historic & I'll continue to work as a partner on the federal level. https://t.co/L1rtUrtRfO

Veteran-owned small businesses play an important role in our communities and in our nation’s economy. This week is #NationalVeteransSmallBusinessWeek, and we celebrate the contributions by our veteran small business owners nationwide. https://t.co/MtiW8pwmdu

My heart breaks for the victims and families of the senseless violence in Ventura County, Calif., including Sheriff’s Sergeant Ron Helus. We pray for them as we thank and pray for the heroes of law enforcement and first responders who rush to protect innocent lives.

Honor the veteran(s) in your life this #VeteransDay by recording and submitting their stories to @librarycongress Veterans History Project - home to the largest oral history archive in the U.S. Learn more: https://t.co/IdbeCTdZck

Middle Georgia veterans: Several opportunities here regarding upcoming Veterans Day events in the area. Via @TelegraphGA: This Veterans Day event offers combat veterans a chance to tell their stories https://t.co/xC8DIPFVV0

Georgia colleges & universities are attracting more students & seeing them through to graduation. With dual enrollment & graduate courses, there are more opportunities to engage in higher ed, & I appreciate the @BORUSG’s commitment to making college more affordable & accessible. https://t.co/r1S1YbJGDG

Georgia veterans, don’t forget that @gavetsvc is here to serve and support you. Commissioner Mike Roby oversees this important state agency, and you can learn more at the department’s website: https://t.co/bEKXt6vLTQ.

Congratulations to these seven Georgia employers on receiving @VETS_DOL ‘Medallion Program Demonstration Award’ for their commitment to hiring veterans, transitioning service members and their spouses. https://t.co/WH3LsFz9n3

Military coins are like a photo album to the men and women in uniform. For every coin, there’s a story of accomplishment. Now, the @AUG_University ROTC cadets have their own coin, and they fought hard to get it. https://t.co/RLcfKYSVoY
Happy Birthday to the @USMC. Thank you for defending our country for 243 years! https://t.co/nAAZJB3uua
As @VAChair, our committee is dedicated to ensuring that our veterans receive the best care @DeptVetAffairs can offer. https://t.co/Xe9fDtp3x9
This is the greatest country on Earth because of the great men and women who fought in our military. I’m proud to honor our veterans today and every day. #VeteransDay https://t.co/r8yINK5kkI
ICYMI: My #VeteransDay op-ed honoring the veterans and service members who fought for our freedom and liberty. For without our veterans, there would be no America.  https://t.co/Or3bsREV3t

Earlier this year, I had the honor of presenting the POW Medal to 96-year-old U.S. Army veteran Ralph Rumsey nearly 73 years after his release. Mr. Rumsey’s service is what our country is about. Without heroes like him, our republic would cease to exist. https://t.co/2q6hvWwATE

We had a very special #VeteransDay opportunity honoring @USNavy veteran Marilyn Clark and her family as we dedicated her home with @NWmetATLHabitat. Thank you for your service! https://t.co/B5tEwOtAZE
I was thankful to honor our veterans again today at @JohnsonFerry Baptist Church’s annual Veterans Day Appreciation luncheon. https://t.co/FmbMF88ubd

The @universityofga football team is doing an outstanding job again this season, but my alma mater stands out even more in academics, outreach and preparing students for the future! Great to meet with President Jere Morehead today to hear the latest news from campus and beyond. https://t.co/E2bY64MvMP

Our @GaPorts are setting records nonstop this year! We’re working to make sure we complete the deepening of the Savannah Harbor to ensure that this type of growth will continue. https://t.co/l6JUfjnMNT
Our ‘Drive Safer Sunday’ resolution is an important reminder to slow down on our roadways this holiday season. https://t.co/UdlMeowJLW

Our ag producers are confronting many challenges due to #HurricaneMichael. I was glad to hear from Georgia Dept. of Ag @GeorgiaGrown, @GaFarmBureau, @GeorgiaPecans, Georgia Blueberry Commission, & the Georgia Fruit and Vegetable Growers Association today about how we can help. https://t.co/9QTqHkaJrm
Our interns have been very busy this semester helping our office and learning more about the government. We enjoyed an informative discussion this morning over breakfast. https://t.co/UOVDUSciuI
Good meeting this morning with Lowndes Co. Commission officials, including Chairman Bill Slaughter, for an update on the area's veterans and Moody Air Force Base. https://t.co/w4cfB7dokq

Appreciated sitting down with @USArmy @SecretaryEsper yesterday to discuss Georgia's @FortBenning, @FGPAO, @USAGStewartHAAF and efforts to ensure a safe housing environment for our military families. https://t.co/ZACJyzZNEl

Congratulations @GeorgiaTech on the news that @ARPAE will invest $5.3 million for energy-related technologies research. Clear examples of #CreatingtheNext! More about these projects: https://t.co/TlN36ZO1zy
The @JacksonCoGA chamber was in D.C. for meetings yesterday, and I was glad to sit down with them to discuss priorities for the area. https://t.co/Q6B2O9yZzQ

Proud to earn the @NFIB “Guardian of Small Business Award” for my support of small and independent businesses in the 115th Congress. Scorecard: https://t.co/ScK9ZKZdl2 #SmallBizGuardian #SmallBiz https://t.co/siJalzi8TE

I'm pleased @CDCgov announced Parkinson’s disease & multiple sclerosis will be its first conditions included in the National Neurological Conditions Surveillance System- a part of the #CuresAct- to advance research on these & other neurological conditions. https://t.co/qa3rEDjZbO

Our @YoungFarmers are in town for their #nyfcconvergence. They met yesterday with @SecretarySonny, and I was glad to welcome some of our Georgia #youngfarmers to the Senate today. https://t.co/ZpwPFN5RR9

Thank you to everyone who attended the Senate Veterans Appreciation Reception. It was a great opportunity to honor members of Congress, staff and all who have served and continue to serve in the U.S. armed services. https://t.co/L4slAwWRHC
As @VAChair, I’m proud of all that we have accomplished on behalf of our nation’s veterans, and I thank @POTUS @realDonaldTrump for his support. https://t.co/knZWG6YGgh

The Senate has passed a bill @sendavidperdue and I introduced to name a U.S. Post Office in Columbus, Ga., the “Richard W. Williams, Jr., Chapter of the Triple Nickles (555th P.I.A.) Post Office.” More about our nation’s first all-black parachute unit: https://t.co/MwKna895Bk

This month is #NationalFamilyCaregiversMonth. Thank you to all those who sacrifice their time, give their love and compassion, and dedicate their lives to improving the lives of veterans. https://t.co/wnNv6Pz9Rs

Teachers, you may want to consider making plans on Monday to participate as @librarycongress commemorates the 155th anniversary of President Lincoln’s Gettysburg Address. Additional resources: https://t.co/6QeJTgBMZt https://t.co/7JzrKdy99E

At 1:00 p.m. today, @POTUS will present the Presidential Medal of Freedom to Senate President pro tempore and @GOPSenFinance Chairman @senorrinhatch. Congratulations to Sen. Hatch and to each of the recipients of this prestigious award. https://t.co/QEQhAge9lo
The Senate passed our 'Drive Safer Sunday' resolution yesterday to remind drivers to practice caution on the roadways throughout the holidays. https://t.co/UdlMeowJLW https://t.co/l2EQi1Gx4H
Thanks to the wonderful interns who have been with us in our Atlanta office this semester. We appreciate all that you do! https://t.co/D1k7eJodsc

It was a true honor to be able to participate in the home dedication with @NWmetATLHabitat on Veterans Day in Douglasville, Ga., for @USNavy veteran Marilyn Clark and her family. Thanks to @NeighborNews for helping us share this positive story. #thankaveteran https://t.co/lJofYHpRNl

We celebrated our nation’s proud veterans this week with multiple Veterans Day activities, and after spending time in Georgia in October, we returned to work in the Senate. Read more in our enewsletter:   https://t.co/aK9DXujhB7
